lines.text: She was a very beautiful girl. One hates to perform an autopsy on a beautiful girl.
Yes sir, but I really should announce you.
My dear girl, if I allowed myself to be announced, I doubt I would be received anywhere.
Pardon me, Professor, but didn't I just see you outside baying at the moon?

There is an air of inquiry about you that immediately offends my deepest nature! Something suggesting Scotland Yard, the French Sécurité, the Italian Carabinieri, the Turkish Polizi, and other minions of the law!
My little friend Indigo is deaf and dumb, he cannot hear and he cannot speak, but reads the lips. And I will advise you to say nothing to annoy him, for his temper is as short as he is.
So it is you, Leonide. I was warned you might appear, like one of you own illusions out of nowhere.
I did not mean to imply that there were any abnormal goings-on here.
I assure you, Mrs. Williams, that there is not, nor will there be.
Nevertheless doctor, the way you were described to me, and the way your place was described to me, I am certain that I am in the right place!
There were screams inside! You gotta admit that it's in the longitude of my profession to make with an investigatory reaction there to- What am I saying?
Ms Lilybeth, have you a little more coffee in the kitchen?
What happened to the three gallons I already gave you today?
It is a pleasure to meet one of my youthful admirers.
Terry Lee of the Central City Times.
The press? Well, it's nice to have known you.
[Leonide turns and walks away]
Has no one arranged to silence you yet, Mr. Lee? What a pity.
It is my peculiar misfortune to always be in a position to where I may eavesdrop.
I'm sorry, but the doctor won't see anybody without an appointment.
I have had an appointment with him for at least twenty years, he will see me!
beware of the man with the green mask!

[after walking up to a body laying on a stretcher in the morgue, covered by a sheet]
Is this the body?
